ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I'd recommend it to another student if they were like me - without much understanding of anything about China.
Yes. I learned a lot and thought that the work load, assignments were very reasonable.
you learn about some political theory, some recent history of Chinese international relations and discuss possible future developments . I would recommend this course.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course greatly improved my understanding of the greater issues affecting China, and why it is not the huge monolith that uninformed or sensational sources make it out to be. I feel that I understand some of the tension and tumult within China, and am curious to learn more after this. A great course to get broken in to the complex topic of China politics.
Meaningful in allowing me to explore IR both in theory and practice.
not my field, but I learned a lot about pre-2000 relations with China and China's rhetoric on US actions.
